SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class Cookbook

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.Cookbook
public class Cookbook extends Object
A class representing a cook book.

The class provides methods for adding and removing recipes, as well as retrieving recipes by name. It also has methods for sorting the recipes in the cook book alphabetically by name, and for removing all recipes from the cook book.

Since:
V0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • Cookbook

      public Cookbook()

  • Method Details

    • getRecipes

      public List<Recipe> getRecipes()
      Returns a list of all recipes in the cook book.
      Returns:
      a list of all recipes in the cook book

    • getRecipe

      public Recipe getRecipe(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the recipe with the provided name.

      If the name is null or an empty string, or if no recipe with the provided name is found, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe
      Returns:
      the recipe with the provided name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no recipe with the provided name is found, or if the name is null or blank.

    • addRecipe

      public void addRecipe(Recipe recipe) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a recipe to the cook book.

      After adding the recipe, the list of recipes is sorted alphabetically by name.

      If the recipe object is null, or if the recipe already exists in the cook book, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      recipe - the Recipe object to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the recipe object is null

    • removeRecipe

      public void removeRecipe(Recipe recipe) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes a recipe from the cook book.

      If the recipe object is null, or if the recipe does not exist in the cook book, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      recipe - the Recipe object to remove from the cook book
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the recipe object is null or if the recipe does not exist in the cook book.

    • sortRecipes

      public void sortRecipes()
      Sorts the recipes in the cook book by name, in alphabetical order.

    • removeAllRecipes

      public void removeAllRecipes()
      Removes all recipes from the cook book.
